precondition: The user is on the Windows XP desktop. No other windows are open.
expected_results: A context menu should appear with options like 'Arrange Icons By', 'Refresh', 'Paste', 'Paste Shortcut', 'New', and 'Properties'.

precondition: The desktop context menu is open.
expected_results: The 'Display Properties' window should open to the 'Themes' tab.

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open. The 'Themes', 'Desktop', 'Screen Saver', 'Appearance', and 'Settings' tabs are visible.
expected_results: The 'Display Properties' window should display the 'Screen Saver' tab options, including 'Screen saver' dropdown menu, 'Wait' time setting, 'On resume, password protect' checkbox, 'Monitor power' instructions, 'Settings', 'Preview', 'Power...', 'Apply', 'Cancel', and 'OK' buttons.

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open to the 'Screen Saver' tab. The 'Screen saver' dropdown menu is visible.
action: Clicks on the 'Settings' button next to the 'Screen saver' dropdown menu.
expected_results: The 'Settings' button should become greyed out, indicating it is unavailable. No new windows or menus should appear.

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open to the 'Screen Saver' tab. The 'Screen saver' dropdown menu is visible.
action: Clicks on the down arrow of the 'Screen saver' dropdown menu.
expected_results: A list of available screen savers should appear, including options like '3D FlowerBox', '3D Flying Objects', '3D Text', 'Blank', 'Bubbles', 'Marquee', 'My Pictures Slideshow', 'Starfield', and 'Windows XP'.

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open to the 'Screen Saver' tab. The 'Screen saver' dropdown menu is open, displaying a list of screen savers.
action: Selects 'None' from the 'Screen saver' dropdown menu.
expected_results: The 'Screen saver' dropdown menu should show 'None' as the selected option. The preview window should now be empty.

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open to the 'Screen Saver' tab.
expected_results: The 'Power Options Properties' window should open. The 'Power Schemes' tab should be active.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open. The 'Power schemes' dropdown menu is visible.
action: Clicks on the down arrow of the 'Power schemes' dropdown menu.
expected_results: A list of available power schemes should appear, including options such as 'Home/Office Desk', 'Portable/Laptop', 'Presentation', 'Always On', 'Minimal Power Management', and 'Max Battery'.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open. The 'Power schemes' dropdown menu is open, displaying a list of power schemes.
action: Selects 'Always On' from the 'Power schemes' dropdown menu.
expected_results: The 'Power schemes' dropdown menu should show 'Always On' as the selected option. The 'Settings for Always On power scheme' should update to reflect the settings for the 'Always On' scheme.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open. The 'Settings for Always On power scheme' section is visible, including dropdown menus for 'Turn off monitor', 'Turn off hard disks', 'System standby', and 'System hibernates'.
action: Clicks on the down arrow of the 'Turn off hard disks' dropdown menu.
expected_results: A list of time intervals should appear, including options like 'After 1 min', 'After 2 mins', 'After 3 mins', and so on.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open. The 'Turn off hard disks' dropdown menu is open, displaying a list of time intervals.
action: Selects 'Never' from the 'Turn off hard disks' dropdown menu.
expected_results: The 'Turn off hard disks' dropdown menu should show 'Never' as the selected option.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open. The 'Apply' button is visible.
expected_results: The 'Apply' button should become greyed out, indicating the settings have been applied. No changes should be visible in the window.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open. The 'OK' button is visible.
expected_results: The 'Power Options Properties' window should close.

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open. The 'OK' button is visible.
